data.title: Adobe Work From Home
data.meta_description: Adobe Creative Cloud is a software as a service (SaaS) offering from Adobe Systems that gives users access to Adobes Creative Suite products for graphic design, video editing, web development, photography, and cloud services. Software from Creative Cloud is downloaded from the Internet, installed directly on a local PC and used as long as the subscription remains valid.
data.text:
Technical assistance from American River College is limited since the Work-at-Home software resides on personal machines that are not owned or managed by the College.

The Los Rios IT Support HelpDesk will not be able to assist with training, application support, or the installation of the Work-at-Home products on your personal device.

Listed below are several free support options available to you:

Creative Cloud Help Center and tutorial videos are available athttps://helpx.adobe.com/creative-cloud.html

The Adobe User Forums are also a great resource and can be found athttp://forums.adobe.com/community/creative_cloud

If you experience any issues with product serial numbers, please call Adobe at 1-800-833-6687. To avoid potential hold times, you may request a call back.

In order to use the Adobe software to its fullest capabilities it is critical that the machine meets minimum requirements for installation. Prior to purchase and installation of any Adobe software, please verify that the computer meets Adobe's suggested Minimum System Requirements necessary to operate the software. Requirements can be found at http://www.adobe.com/products/creativecloud/tech-specs.html

To get the newest version of Adobe apps working after your Adobe Invitation email is received, please follow next steps:

Uninstall all old Adobe applications. Every application that has Adobe name in it must be uninstalled. If you have problems uninstalling old Adobe software, please use this guide

Download and install Adobe Creative Cloud apps

Open a newly installed Adobe Creative Cloud Application; sign in again following guides above if asked. You can install any desired Adobe application that appears in the "Available in your plan" section.

To sign in, use your regular work email address @arc.losrios.edu. Click Continue button. If prompted, select Company or School Account. You will be forwarded to the Los Rios Single Sign On page asking for your wID and Los Rios password. You will also be required to Authenticate through DUO. Once you have logged in, scroll up and down to choose the software you want to install. Each Adobe product has a separate install.

If you open a PDF directly from a web browser that has a PDF extension installed, the file will open inside the browser. To open directly in Adobe, you will need to save the document to your computer before opening.

If you find that when you double-click on a saved PDF and it opens in Adobe Reader, it means Adobe Reader is set as the default for PDF documents. To bypass this, you can right click the file and chose Open With... search for and choose Adobe Acrobat Pro.

If Acrobat no longer works for you, you may need to log back into Adobe using your primary ARC email account by clicking the round icon in the top right corner of Acrobat Pro or another Adobe program you have installed.
